thread.title: Nine complaints received about traffic jams while sending patients to hospital
thread.title_full: Nine complaints received about traffic jams while sending patients to hospital

title: Nine complaints received about traffic jams while sending patients to hospital
text:
Sunday, 19 February 2017 Nine complaints received about traffic jams while sending patients to hospital Hear our plea: Tan (right) and Ooi expressing the need for the venue of the Penang Hot Air Balloon Fiesta to be moved to a more suitable area in future. 
GEORGE TOWN: Penang MCA received nine complaints over the venue of the Penang Hot Air Balloon Fiesta 2017 which took place at the Polo Ground opposite the Penang Hospital. 
Komtar MCA task force chief Tan Hing Teik said the complaints were from relatives of hospital patients who were stuck in traffic due to the recent two-day event. 
“The complainants claimed that they were caught in heavy traffic for about 15 to 20 minutes when they wanted to send the patients to the hospital. 
“Luckily, they were not critical cases,” he told a press conference at Wisma MCA in Transfer Road here yesterday. 
Tan, who was tasked by the state MCA to handle the matter, showed reporters two video clips of traffic jams along Jalan Residensi leading to Polo Ground which he claimed occurred during this year’s fiesta. 
One clip showed an ambulance moving slowly in heavy traffic. 
“I received the video clips from the public,” Tan said. 
He said the Polo Ground should not be used as a venue for the fiesta as it was the helicopter landing spot for the hospital’s emergency cases. 
He questioned the Penang Island City Council for approving the event to be held there. 
“Penang MCA is not against the event as this is something good for Penang but we want the state government to change its venue to a more suitable place in future,” Tan said. 
Penang MCA Youth vice-secretary Ooi Teik Liang said that although there were 1,200 parking bays prepared for the fiesta, some visitors to the event still parked their vehicles at the hospital.
